sentences.en: Although it would be a wrench, we would all accept the challenge of moving abroad.
sentences.cn: 虽然移居海外会很痛苦，但我们都愿意接受这个挑战。

sentences.en: Don't wrench the facts in order to make the report more excitng.
sentences.cn: 不要为了使报告更激动人心而歪曲事实.

sentences.en: He felt two men wrench the suitcase from his hand.
sentences.cn: 他感觉有两个人在使劲拽他手里的手提箱。

sentences.en: He gave a wrench to his ankle when he jumped down.
sentences.cn: 他跳下去的时候扭伤了足踝.

sentences.en: He gave his elbow a wrench when he fell off the ladder.
sentences.cn: 他从梯子上摔下时扭伤了胳膊肘.

sentences.en: He grabbed the rope and gave it a wrench.
He pulled the handle off with a wrench.
sentences.cn: 他一拧就把把手拧了下来.

sentences.en: I always knew it would be a wrench to leave Essex after all these years.
sentences.cn: 我一直心里清楚过了这么多年后离开埃塞克斯会非常痛苦。

sentences.en: I had to run around to several shops to get that wrench.
sentences.cn: 我跑了好几家商店,才找到那种扳手.

sentences.en: I had to wrench the lid off the barrel, it was stuck tight.
sentences.cn: 我必须把桶盖拧下来, 它太紧了.

sentences.en: I wrenched the packet from his grasp.
sentences.cn: 我用力夺过他攥在手里的纸袋。

sentences.en: It was a wrench to leave the old home.
sentences.cn: 离开这个老家非常痛苦.

sentences.en: Leaving New York had been a terrible wrench.
sentences.cn: 离开纽约让人十分伤感。

sentences.en: Many of the things are of great sentimental value and it is going to be a wrench parting with them.
sentences.cn: 其中很多东西都具有重要的情感价值，令人难以割舍。

sentences.en: My moment of sleep is a great wrench, an agony.
sentences.cn: 我那短促的睡眠, 简直是一种要命的痛苦和折磨.

sentences.en: Parting with her mother was a great wrench.
sentences.cn: 同母亲分别对她是极大的痛苦.

sentences.en: The door had been wrenched open.
The plumber took out a wrench and tightened the bolt.
sentences.cn: 管子工拿出一把扳手拧紧了螺栓.

sentences.en: There was a wrench in Frand's mind.
sentences.cn: 富兰克感到心头一阵剧痛.

words.tran_cn: 扳手，[机]扳钳；扭伤；痛苦；歪曲；猛扭

phrases.tran_cn: 拧紧扳手，套筒板手；冲头
扭力扳手；转矩扳手；定力矩扳手

trans.tran_en: a twisting movement that pulls something violently
to twist and pull something roughly from the place where it is being held
to twist and pull something roughly from the place where it is being held
to twist and pull something roughly from the place where it is being held
